content: Singaporean footballer **Emyl Leclercq** (born 6 December 2002) is a Singaporean professional [footballer](/wiki/Association_football) who plays as a [goalkeeper](/wiki/Goalkeeper_(association_football)). He was born in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) to a [French](/wiki/French_people) father and a Singaporean mother of [Malay](/wiki/Malay_people) descent. ## Career A youth product of La Brède FC, Leclercq joined the youth academy of [Chamois Niortais](/wiki/Chamois_Niortais_F.C.) in 2017. He debuted for Chamois Niortais in a 2–0 [Ligue 2](/wiki/Ligue_2) loss to [LB Châteauroux](/wiki/LB_Ch%C3%A2teauroux) on 3 October 2020. He signed for [Championnat National](/wiki/Championnat_National) club [SO Cholet](/wiki/SO_Cholet) on 2 June 2021. - Chamois Niortais profile Archived 2021-05-03 at the [Wayback Machine](/wiki/Wayback_Machine) This biographical article related to Singaporean association football is a stub. title: Emyl Leclercq
